Check database availability and health as part of infrastructure status - verifies all databases are accessible and not corrupted

helpers.name: get_supportive_context
helpers.purpose: Returns the full supportive context reference document (FP code examples, DRY patterns, state database usage, Use Case 2 details, behavioral rules, edge case recovery). Loaded automatically by aifp_run(is_new_session=true). Call directly to reload detailed reference material when context feels stale or compressed.
helpers.error_handling: Returns error if supportive_context.txt not found at expected path. Never fails hard — returns informative error message.
return_statements: AI should cache this content for the session. Call again if context feels stale.
implementation_notes: Returns: {success: true, content: str (full text), token_estimate: int}
Path resolved relative to package installation (Path(__file__).parent.parent / 'reference' / 'guides' / 'supportive_context.txt')
Called internally by aifp_run(is_new_session=true) — content included in session bundle under 'supportive_context' key
Referenced in aifp_run(is_new_session=false) return so AI knows it can reload
No database access — pure file read operation
Estimated ~3-4k tokens for the full document

used_by_directives.description: aifp_run bundles supportive context on is_new_session=true for comprehensive session startup
